name: Hapuku Lodge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in one of the well appointed rooms - but the real magic of this place are the tree houses
reviews.title: If you don't stay in a tree house you will be disappointed

likes.disliked: — The dinner menu was very very limited

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were very excited about staying in a tree house for our last 2 nights and we weren't disappointed. The accomodation was truly boutique in style and standard. We loved it. It was great to have a mountain view at one end and a sea view at the other - truly brilliant. The jacquzzi bath and shower both in the window was unique and the seats and the wood burning stove was very cosy.
reviews.title: Fab unique accomodation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 1 night en route from Marlborough to Christchurch, and were not at all disappointed by the tree-house accomodation. It was fantastic - a grown-up incarnation of a childhood dream! The design and finishing is clearly top-notch - very unusual and well-considered textures and inclusions. The wood fire in the treehouse was a huge bonus for us - sitting in the recliner chairs, watching the fire, with the snow-capped Southern Alps glowing in the moonlight as the backdrop will remain a favourite memory.
reviews.title: Stunning, a very memorable stay

reviews.text: We opted for dinner onsite at the hotel, and the food was very good (as was the wine and service). However... beware that it is a communal dinner with all guests at a common table, not an intimate dinner for 2 (as we had expected!). This situation clearly took all 4 couples by surprise - and most of us made the best of it by adapting and having a laugh about it. (One other couple were not so gracious, making it fairly plain they felt their anniversary dinner had been ruined by the group arrangement. It was our anniversary too - so while empathising, it highlights the real issue of communal dinners - the guests are pot-luck too...).
reviews.title: Huge Space and Great Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Definitely recommendable to stay here - pricey, yes, but amazing surrounds, and conducive to a cozy evening. However perhaps either specifically request a private dinner, or go to a conventional restaurant in town...
reviews.title: Amazing construction and views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 2 nights whilst on honeymoon. We were very impressed by the architecture and the setting - from one window in our room we had a view of snow capped mountains and from the other we could see the ocean. The service was great - personal, friendly and genuinely interested in making your stay there as comfortable as possible. They were aware that we were on honeymoon and were kind enough to give us a bottle of champagne to congratulate us.
reviews.title: A very

likes.disliked: — Only a shower in our room (but a great one!)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If we returned I would stay in a tree house as they are even more luxurious. If I could make any small criticism it would be that I was slightly disappointed not to have a bath in the room. Although our room was great with an ipod and dock, DVD player (DVDs can be borrowed free of charge), comfortable bed etc., I'm more of a bath person (although the shower was glorious) and I believe that a bath is standard in the treehouses.
reviews.title: PLEASANT stay & AMAZING place
Tried to stay here
reviews.text: All in all though, this is a wonderful unique place to stay that I would highly recommend.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay at this stunning place was on August 2007.
reviews.title: So Incredible

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hapuku Lodge is located 12 kms north of the renowned, eco-marine town of Kaikoura on New Zealand's South Island. The lodge is surrounded by an expansive deer farm and olive trees grove. Hapuku Lodge is situated in one of the most spectacular settings in New Zealand, nestled between the Kaikoura Seaward Mountain Range and famed Mangamaunu Bay.
reviews.title: Fabulous place, great location

likes.liked: — Personal service and the standard of accommodation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: WOW is all I can say. The treehouse was amazing. The view incredible. The bathroom and bath tub such a treat. Showering overlooking the olive trees was very special. Words really can't describe how beautiful this place is. We sat by our private fireplace at night looking up at the stars...very romantic. Our only regret is not staying longer. We stayed is some wonderful places in NZ and this one was by far our favorite.
reviews.title: Spectacular

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed one night at Hapuka over six months ago and we still talk about it. I'm not an easy guest, and of all the places we stayed in New Zealand, this was the absolute best. The only contender was Huka Lodge which cost about 5 times as much. We stayed in a fancy tree house with glass walls facing snow-capped mountains on side and the coast on the other. We were not there long but we loved every moment. I hope to get back some day soon.
reviews.title: One of the best places we've been

likes.disliked: — Not many restaurant options in the area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Who would've thought that tree houses could be this luxurious! Beautifully presented, luxurious, private and cosy. This is the ultimate treat for a romantic getaway. The bed was huge and comfy and there was a scandanavian log fire... absolute bliss, especially considering the bad weather. We could've holed up in there for weeks, but were forced to emerge for food occasionally.
reviews.title: Tree house chic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had mixed feelings about the food at the lodge. We felt that dinner was a little pricey for what we were getting (even by London standards). We could tell there was an ambitious chef by the overly complex dishes on the menu, but parts of the meal just felt like they were trying too hard to impress and not quite pulling it off, which left us a little dissatisfied. We would've preferred something simpler but better executed perhaps. We had a lovely meal in an organic restaurant in town which was better and cheaper the next night however. Breakfasts were nice but we weren't offered any cooked options. Service was generally good. The tree house itself did not disappoint one bit though and I'd definitely recommend them.
reviews.title: Incredible confluence of architecture and nature

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Your experience of Hapuku may depend on your accomodations. In my usual frugality I asked our travel agent to book us into a lodge room. When we arrived a treehouse was available. After a tour we decided immediately to upgrade.
reviews.title: Amazing treehouse!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the lodge in February for 2 nights and had a wonderful time. Our room in the lodge was twice the size of previous accomodation, a view over a field full of deer, and the most comfortable bed we have slept in for quite a while. What a peaceful location to recharge your batteries.
reviews.title: What a room - wow!

likes.liked: — Large spacious rooms with a great view
likes.disliked: — Dining room not cleaned between evening meal and breakfast

reviews.text: The breakfast was slightly disappointing in respect of the choice available, and on the 2nd day, when we arrived later for breakfast the choice was even more limited, but staff could not have been more helpful and replenished items as requested. No hot options but cereal, fruit, cheese, ham, muffins and danishes, plus a variety of breads available, so no chance of going hungry.
reviews.title: Things have changed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Whilst I agree with the previous reviewer that the NZD 75$ set menu is rather highly priced, our meal was fantastic, food was plentiful, hot and very well served and it was nice to enjoy a bottle of wine with the meal rather than having to drive into Kaikoura, as we had done the night before. Although if you do drive into Kaikoura and fancy a really nice fish restaurant try the Green Dolphin (located at the further point of the road past the pier) - food was fantastic and about NZD 100$ for 2.
reviews.title: Amazing Place

likes.liked: — The view, the space, the design

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did notice that the dining room had not been cleaned between the evening meal and breakfast the next morning and therefore cannot give the hotel 'excellent' but other than this I believe in the saying you get what you pay for, and this hotel maybe more expensive but for us it was worth every penny for a great nights sleep and fantastic setting.
reviews.title: Stunning Even for this Cynic!

likes.disliked: — lack of access to food establishments

reviews.text: The Lodge is well designed and enjoys a beautifull location, but appears to have fallen on hard times no doubt due to current management. The ceiling in our room had leaked and had not been repaired. As the Lodge is located about 15km from Kaikoura, we opted to eat in the dining room. It offered only a NZ$ 75 price fix menu which it turns out was grossly overpriced. When our main courses arrived, the meat was perched on an unidentifiable mound of starch and both meat and starch were cold. As bad as the food was, the service was worse. After waiting over half an hour for desert ( there were only two on the menu) and being ignored by the waiter, one of our party got up and left. It is hard to understand the poor service as on ly 20 dinners were served that evening with two wait staff.
reviews.title: Romantic, Great Views, Beautiful Architecture!

description: Hapuku Lodge and Tree Houses is distinctive boutique luxury accommodation set on a deer farm and olive grove in one of the world's most beautiful locations, between the Kaikoura Mountains and the Pacific Coast of New Zealand's South Island.
